resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:52246224</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-CGU</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Stagg, Amos Alonzo, 1862-1965.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Papers, 1866-1964.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Contains correspondence, personal papers, reports, notebooks, newspaper clippings, scrapbooks, photograph albums, books, and professional and scholastic emphemera that span Stagg's personal and professional life, 1866-1964. The majority of the collection documents Stagg's coaching career at the University of Chicago and his impact on national intercollegiate athletics, amateur sports, and education. The collection also includes material on the founding of the University of Chicago, its presidents and developments in education until 1933. Material documents the effects of World War I and II on American collegiate life, the history of the Olympics until 1928, the establishment of professional sports, prohibition, leading national and sports figures, and Chicago during the Jazz Age. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of Chicago Library</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Papers, 1866-1964.
resource.abstract: Contains correspondence, personal papers, reports, notebooks, newspaper clippings, scrapbooks, photograph albums, books, and professional and scholastic emphemera that span Stagg's personal and professional life, 1866-1964. The majority of the collection documents Stagg's coaching career at the University of Chicago and his impact on national intercollegiate athletics, amateur sports, and education. The collection also includes material on the founding of the University of Chicago, its presidents and developments in education until 1933. Material documents the effects of World War I and II on American collegiate life, the history of the Olympics until 1928, the establishment of professional sports, prohibition, leading national and sports figures, and Chicago during the Jazz Age.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <did xmlns="urn:isbn:1-931666-22-9">
                  <unittitle>Knoles Family collection</unittitle>
                  <unitdate>ca.
		1870s-1990s</unitdate>
                  <unitid>MSS 302</unitid>
                  <origination>
                     <famname>Knoles family</famname>
                  </origination>
                  <physdesc>
                     <extent>3 linear feet</extent>
                  </physdesc>
                  <repository>
                     <corpname>University of the Pacific. Library. Holt-Atherton Dept. of
		  Special Collections</corpname>
                     <address>
                        <addressline>Stockton, California 95211</addressline>
                     </address>
                  </repository>
                  <abstract>Collection consists of a variety of documents
		from the Knoles family, including letters, clippings, and photographs. Tully
		Knoles is the primary focus of the material, but many other family members are
		also represented. </abstract>
                  <physloc>For current information on the location
		of these materials, please consult the library's online catalog.</physloc>
                  <langmaterial> Languages represented in the collection:
	 <language>English</language>
                  </langmaterial>
               </did>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Knoles Family collection ca.1870s-1990s
resource.abstract: Collection consists of a variety of documentsfrom the Knoles family, including letters, clippings, and photographs. TullyKnoles is the primary focus of the material, but many other family members arealso represented.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:33069717</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-UOP</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Taylor, Elliott J.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Burta & Elliott Taylor collection, 1922-1986.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Record Group I, Series 1 consists of correspondence between Elliott J. Taylor, Burta Beers Taylor, their families and friends. Principal subject matter is teaching and study activities in Rome, Albania, Vienna, Bryn Mawr (Pa.) and Stockton (Calif.). Record Group I, Series 2 contains Taylor speeches, essays, reports, diaries, notes, and memorabilia. Record Group II consists of slides, films and videotapes. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of the Pacific</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Burta & Elliott Taylor collection, 1922-1986.
resource.abstract: Record Group I, Series 1 consists of correspondence between Elliott J. Taylor, Burta Beers Taylor, their families and friends. Principal subject matter is teaching and study activities in Rome, Albania, Vienna, Bryn Mawr (Pa.) and Stockton (Calif.). Record Group I, Series 2 contains Taylor speeches, essays, reports, diaries, notes, and memorabilia. Record Group II consists of slides, films and videotapes.
resource.displayEntry: Taylor, Elliott J. Burta & Elliott Taylor collection, 1922-1986.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:35191720</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-UOP</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Stagg, Amos Alonzo, 1862-1965.</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Amos Alonzo Stagg papers, 1905-1939.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Box 1 contains correspondence with various colleges about football game scheduling (1899-1932); clippings, essays and correspondence on professionalism in sports (1911-1923).  Boxes 2-3 contain clippings on Stagg's life.  Box 4 contains Stagg photos, film and memorabilia. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of the Pacific</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Amos Alonzo Stagg papers, 1905-1939.
resource.abstract: Box 1 contains correspondence with various colleges about football game scheduling (1899-1932); clippings, essays and correspondence on professionalism in sports (1911-1923).  Boxes 2-3 contain clippings on Stagg's life.  Box 4 contains Stagg photos, film and memorabilia.
resource.displayEntry: Stagg, Amos Alonzo, 1862-1965. Amos Alonzo Stagg papers, 1905-1939.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:237202519</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-UOP</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Wood, Carlos Claude</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Carlos Wood Papers, 1936-1992.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>The majority of the collection consists of materials generated during Wood's time at Douglas Aircraft and Sikorsky Aircraft.There are some materials included that were created during his time as a member of the Board of Regents for Pacific.The materials include both personal and business correspondence, memos, photos, and other publications. Included is biographical information that gives great detail on both Sikorsky and Douglas Aircraft, which involves management and aeronautical matters, as well as insight into the life of an aircraft engineer from the late 1920s to 1970s. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of the Pacific</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Carlos Wood Papers, 1936-1992.
resource.abstract: The majority of the collection consists of materials generated during Wood's time at Douglas Aircraft and Sikorsky Aircraft.There are some materials included that were created during his time as a member of the Board of Regents for Pacific.The materials include both personal and business correspondence, memos, photos, and other publications. Included is biographical information that gives great detail on both Sikorsky and Douglas Aircraft, which involves management and aeronautical matters, as well as insight into the life of an aircraft engineer from the late 1920s to 1970s.
resource.displayEntry: Wood, Carlos Claude. Carlos Wood Papers, 1936-1992.

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:43925766</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-CUYGB</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Frashers Foto (Pomona, Calif.)</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Death Valley caravan and Sacramento flood snapshots [graphic]. 1935-1940.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Chiefly snapshots of young people (presumably students from the College of the Pacific in Stockton, Calif.) on outings to Death Valley and Boulder (Hoover) Dam in the late 1930's. Also includes sixteen views, with descriptive captions, of the Sacramento flood of March 31, 1940. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of California, Berkeley</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Death Valley caravan and Sacramento flood snapshots [graphic]. 1935-1940.
resource.abstract: Chiefly snapshots of young people (presumably students from the College of the Pacific in Stockton, Calif.) on outings to Death Valley and Boulder (Hoover) Dam in the late 1930's. Also includes sixteen views, with descriptive captions, of the Sacramento flood of March 31, 1940.
resource.extent: 1 album (47 photographic prints) : b&w ; album 18 x 26 cm.
resource.displayEntry: Frashers Foto (Pomona, Calif.). Death Valley caravan and Sacramento flood snapshots [graphic].

resourceRelations.content: Frashers Foto (Pomona, Calif.). Death Valley caravan and Sacramento flood snapshots [graphic].

resource.source:
<objectXMLWrap>
               <mods xmlns="http://www.loc.gov/mods/v3">
                  <recordInfo>
                     <recordOrigin>WorldCat:35178132</recordOrigin>
                     <recordContentSource>ISIL:OCLC-UOP</recordContentSource>
                  </recordInfo>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>Hunt, Rockwell Dennis, 1868-</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/cre">Creator</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
                  <titleInfo>
                     <title>Rockwell D. Hunt papers, 1850-1965.</title>
                  </titleInfo>
                  <abstract>Series I, containing 11 boxes, consists of materials pertaining to personal and family history of Rockwell D. Hunt including school papers and notes, diaries, photos and memorabilia. Series II, containing 7 boxes, consists of correspondence (1890-1966). Series III, containing 46 boxes, consists of drafts, notes and published versions of Rockwell D. Hunt's writings. Series IV, containing 9 boxes, consists of newspaper clippings pertaining to various California history topics. </abstract>
                  <name>
                     <namePart>University of the Pacific</namePart>
                     <role>
                        <roleTerm valueURI="http://id.loc.gov/vocabulary/relators/rps">Repository</roleTerm>
                     </role>
                  </name>
               </mods>
            </objectXMLWrap>
resource.title: Rockwell D. Hunt papers, 1850-1965.
resource.abstract: Series I, containing 11 boxes, consists of materials pertaining to personal and family history of Rockwell D. Hunt including school papers and notes, diaries, photos and memorabilia. Series II, containing 7 boxes, consists of correspondence (1890-1966). Series III, containing 46 boxes, consists of drafts, notes and published versions of Rockwell D. Hunt's writings. Series IV, containing 9 boxes, consists of newspaper clippings pertaining to various California history topics.
resource.displayEntry: Hunt, Rockwell Dennis, 1868-. Rockwell D. Hunt papers, 1850-1965.
